meanings.definition: A person who condemns or prohibits something.
meanings.sent1: The proscribers of the new law were vocal in their opposition.
meanings.sent2: The proscribers of the book argued that it was inappropriate for young readers.
meanings.sent3: The proscribers at the town meeting made everyone laugh with their strict rules.
meanings.sent4: The proscribers of fun were like the rain on a parade, always dampening spirits.
meanings.sent5: The proscribers of change were like stubborn rocks in the river, resisting the flow of progress.

meanings.sent1: She proscribers any form of violence in her classroom.
meanings.sent2: The committee proscribers the use of harmful chemicals in the production process.
meanings.sent3: He proscribers eating sweets after 9 pm to maintain a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent4: The judge proscribers any further delays in the trial, pushing for a quick resolution.
meanings.sent5: The doctor proscribers smoking to all his patients, emphasizing the risks to their health.
